title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 97.3 - Permitted activities
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 97.3 - Permitted activities

State Regulations
A credit union organization may engage in the following
activities: (a) originating, investing
in, purchasing, selling, servicing or otherwise dealing in, directly or through
participation, loans of any type which may be made by a credit union; (b) providing services primarily for other
credit unions (e.g., accounting, auditing, clerical, consulting, data
processing, investment advisory, managerial); (c) providing tax preparation
services; (d) financing leases of
personal property to members; (e) issuing credit cards and engaging in credit card operations; (f) opening and maintaining shared service
centers in accordance with the provisions of section
97.8
of this Part; and
(g) any other activity specifically approved
by the superintendent. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3
ยง
97.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
